info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 7 at 10:51AM EDT until April 7 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in North Carolina...
Tuckasegee River At below Everett St, in Bryson City affecting Swain County.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Tuckasegee River at below Everett St, in Bryson City.
* WHEN...From this morning to this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, River will overflow its banks and will begin to move into the Bear Hunter Campground near Bryson City.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:31 AM EDT Monday the stage was 8.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet this afternoon. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/GSP
The next statement will be issued this evening at 800 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING
